title: Doctor Who and the Silurians
dialogue_triumphs: The Doctor sings the first few lines of Lewis Carroll's 'Jaberwocky' (Through the Looking Glass)
dialogue_disasters: She was found in the barn, paralysed with fear. She may have seen something.
goofs: In the first episode Caroline John says: 'It would make a nite nice trip for us.'
In the first episode Liz's skirt snags on her belt.
We briefly see a 'Silurian' zip in episode seven.
The protective properties of the ozone layer are wrongly attributed to the Van Allen belt.

continuity_notes.name: Silurians/Eocenes
continuity_notes.description: An ancient reptilian species that ruled Earth before humans. They went into hibernation due to a potential catastrophe involving a small planet that became Earth's moon.
continuity_notes.current_status: Awakened from hibernation, in conflict with humans

continuity_notes.name: Bessie
continuity_notes.description: The Third Doctor's yellow vintage car

technobabble: The cyclotron stuff is passable, although marks are deducted for fusing the control of the neutron flow.
Liz, on a possible antidote: 'Have you considered the addition of A37 in the presence of Z19?'
roots: Nigel Kneale's works (The Quatermass Experiment, Quatermass II, Quatermass and the Pit)

locations.name: Wenley Moor Atomic Research Station
locations.description: An underground atomic research establishment with a cyclotron for converting nuclear energy into electrical current
locations.current_status: Active research facility, inadvertently awakened nearby Silurians

additional_notes: Fashion Victims: Liz in an outrageous mini. In episode seven, the Doctor sports a white T-shirt.
bottom_line: This is an engaging story, making good use of its extra episodes and resources (including scenes of people succumbing to the bacteria around Waterloo station). The music, however, sounds like a computerised kazoo.
